subject: Nutrition
title: Refrigeration and the Cold Chain
description: A micro-lesson that makes Refrigeration and the Cold Chain usable.

hook.text: Before refrigerators, city dwellers drank warm milk from cows miles away. Spoilage was constant.

buildup.text: Ice harvesting was a massive industryâ€”blocks were cut from frozen lakes and shipped worldwide.

discovery.text: Mechanical refrigeration in the 1870s created the cold chain, letting fresh food travel across continents.

twist.text: Argentina's beef could suddenly reach London tables fresh. Global food trade exploded overnight.

climax.text: Today, 40% of all food requires refrigeration. Without the cold chain, modern cities couldn't survive.

punchline.text: Keeping food cold reshaped the entire world.

quiz.question: What percentage of food today requires refrigeration?
